CatDescriptText: Portions of the article for related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 25, 1964, pg. 6, read: "Cecelia Trower Becomes Bride of Pitt Educational Coordinator - At the candlelight altar of the Church of the Holy Cross on July 11, lovely Cecelia M. Trower of Pittsburgh, and David E. Epperson of Donora were united in marriage. The Rev. Walter P. H. Parker officiated.  Carrying a white orchid and prayer book and given in marriage by her father, prominent businessman, J. Edward Trower, Cecelia was enchanting in an antique white silk shantung A-line gown with a chapel train.  A fingertip-length tulle mantilla, delicately edged with lace enhanced a face made even more lovely by the occasion....Mrs. Sarah Trower Martin, matron of honor and sister of the bride, and Miss Marlene Stevens, maid of honor....Robert Epperson Jr., was his brothers' best man.  Ushers included Earl Jones of Baltimore, Md.; Marvin Preston, Cleveland, Oh.; William Trower, brother of the bride, and David Russell...serving as aides were Mmes. Dorothy Lightfoot, Ruth Butler, Helen Moxley, Edna Morris, Antoinette Berry, Ida Freeman, and Miss Clara Brock....the couple will be at home at 7158 Tilden St., in Belmar Gardens...."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Trower - Epperson wedding party with best man Robert Epperson Jr., groom David E. Epperson, bride Cecelia Trower Epperson wearing silk shantung gown with boat neck and lace trimmed veil, matron of honor Sara Trower Martin, and maid of honor Marlene Stevens, posed in front of ferns, in Holy Cross Church undercroft
